page.title: 12NEWS IN BURLEY. 1985.
page.content: In the week of June the 12th news came up in the Lymington Times, Western Gazette and the Newforest Post.There was a forest fire destruction which swept across Setley Plain and Latchmoor Hill on Monday 10th June destroying 60 acres of forest land. Trains were stopped for 30 mins until firemen fought the flames. Mrs Anne Powell was awarded a coveted badge for the Red Cross.She lives in Honey Lane and was a member of that Society for over twenty years.She was honoured with this badge on Wednesday 12th June. Sunday 9th June 1985 a car boot sale was held at Burley Primary School. Burley residents don't like to climb the hill to the School for the county council elections.The walk was too much for the elderly people so some did not vote. By Stephen.B and Chris.R
